title: Nick Kouparitsas
text:
Nick Kouparitsas (born ) is a former <a href="Greece%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Greek international</a> <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s and 2010s. A Greece international representative , he played for Canterbury-Bankstown, Sydney Roosters and Harlequins RL.
Background.
Kouparitsas was born in <a href="Canberra%2C%20Australian%20Capital%20Territory">Canberra, Australian Capital Territory</a>, Australia.
Playing career.
While attending <a href="Daramalan%20College">Daramalan College, Canberra</a>, Kouparitsas played for the <a href="Australia%20national%20schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Schoolboys team</a> in 2001.
Kouparitsas made his NRL début for Canterbury-Bankstown in 2006, making three NRL appearances in 2006. Kouparitsas became a regular part of the Canterbury first grade team in 2007. Kouparitsas scored his first NRL try on 22 June 2007 against <a href="Manly-Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly</a> at <a href="Brookvale%20Oval">Brookvale Oval</a>. 
In 2009, Kouparitsas spent the beginning of the season playing NSW Cup for Bulldogs' feeder club, the Bankstown City Bulls. As a result of not playing first grade, a release was sought from Canterbury and Kouparitsas signed with the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> prior to round 8. The deal was meant to go ahead weeks earlier, but Canterbury pulled out of the deal. At the conclusion of the 2009 season, Kouparitsas played in two consecutive wooden spoon teams (Canterbury in 2008 and then the Sydney Roosters in 2009). Kouparitsas joined English club <a href="London%20Broncos%23Harlequins%20RL%20.282006.E2.80.932011.29">Harlequins</a> on a one-year deal for the 2011 Engage <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> season. 
Representative career.
At an international level, Kouparitsas played for <a href="Greece%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Greece</a> in 2005 in a friendly match against <a href="Malta%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Malta</a>. He also took part in the historic first Rugby League match to take place in Greece, which was played in Athens on 28 October 2006. Greece beat <a href="Rugby%20league%20in%20Serbia">Serbia</a> 44–26, in a match that featured <a href="Michael%20Korkidas">Michael Korkidas</a>, who captained Greece.
Post playing.
Kouparitsas is now a real estate agent in Queensland.
